snippet: In a trial this week, nothing short of this city’s future is at stake, with a judge to decide whether to approve a blueprint to eliminate more than $7 billion of its estimated $18 billion in debts.
abstract: Judge Steven W Rhodes is preparing to hear more than a month of testimony in deciding whether to approve municipal bankruptcy plan drawn up by Detroit officials to eliminate more than $7 billion of its estimated $18 billion in debts; Rhode's ruling will send significant messages beyond Detroit about rarely tested powers and limits of municipal bankruptcy, known as Chapter 9, and leaders of other cities will be watching closely.

byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and MARY WILLIAMS WALSH

lead_paragraph: In a trial this week, nothing short of this city’s future is at stake, with a judge to decide whether to approve a blueprint to eliminate more than $7 billion of its estimated $18 billion in debts.

headline.main: One Judge to Decide the Future of Detroit
headline.print_headline: One Judge to Decide the Future of Detroit
